chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard H. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Psychiatric/ pscchological.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
May not have contact with Shativia Cunningham or her daughter, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

8/13/2015 - Plea/sentencing hearing
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State withdraws motion to amend information and other acts motion.  Information is amended on the record that the maximum term of confinement on the repeater enhancer in ct 1 is 4 years instead of 2 years.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 1 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 4.  PSI waived.  Court has reviewed the PSI from file 13CF706.   Victim S.C. present and addressed.  On ct 4 the court imposes a total sentence of 2 years WSP consecutive to 13CF706; 1 year initial confinement; 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 1 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions consecutive to ct 4; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $450 DNA surcharge; pay $100 DV surcharge.
